Reviews.Title: “No star! Run away from Hotel Urbis.”
Reviews.Author: Raymond Y
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel because of the location. But there are many hotels near Rome Termini Train Station, you would be glad that you do not stay at Hotel Urbis. TV does not work, and the receptionist acted like it would and tried to play with the switch a while. He said will find out if switch us to different room or bring a TV, but this issue was never addressed. The free internet on the PC in the hotel lobby did not work. Their own PC works just fine. There is no hot water for shower. They gave different excuses each time you ask them, either someone accidentally shuts it off or someone else used up all the hot water. It is 8 degrees at night by the way! The sewer smell came into our room from the bathroom drain. The wall and door is very thin, you can hear the staffs talking or the phone rings. Out of the three receptionists we encountered only one speaks a little English. The other two ask you to deal with his next shift. The building is very old and the room very dirty. It is by far the worse hotel we have ever stayed through out of our worldly travel. We have a room with private bath. The bathroom is the size of a normal closet. The shower is by the toilet so both toilet and the floor stay wet if you shower. There is a curtain with very disgusting stains on the bottom. We did not dire to use it.

Reviews.Title: “Worst "Hotel" i have ever, ever set foot in”
Reviews.Author: Shr0pshirelad
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the building the accomodation is in at 18.45 in the evening, a head of a 4 day sightseeing trip to Rome, a birthday treat for my Partner Urbis is on the second floor of a large building. There was a street vendor selling handbags on the doorstep, and a tramp asleep in the door way to the grafitti-ridden building, that had a most unpleasant smell of stale urine. in fairness we were treated to a friendly service, and pleasant check in..... then we were escorted to our room....that that contained an uncomfortable bed, a broken wardrobe, a craked sink, and a televsison that did not funtion.......the walls were badly scuffed and dirty, along with the bed sheets.... No Air conditioning and a very, very noisy street view. . i had paid for a triple room ( the only rooms with an en-suite ).... we clearly had not been allocated one. i went to reception to complain - the member of staff could no longer speak english, and told me to come back in the morning and we could be up graded at a cost, if we so wished. the agent we booked through offered no assistance.. we were then told we had to use the commuunal bathroom, that was no bigger than 3m x 3m, filthy, with a soaking wet floor and a dirty shower enclosure that did not work. Truly disgusting, far worse levels of sanitation than i have ever encountered in my life, and after 20 minutes made up our minds to find somewhere else to stay.... we used the free internet PC in the reception to duly book another hotel, 2 streets away..which was unbeleivably brilliant... and duly checked out within 4 hours of arriving and checked in there... i though't i'd got a brilliant deal with this hotel....... but was truly horrified when i arrived and urge anybody even thinking about being tempted by the price NEVER, EVER TO STAY THERE......

Reviews.Title: “ONE STAR TOO MANY!”
Reviews.Author: Martina J
Reviews.Content: This is hardly a hotel in the first place, not even a hostel. We had found out on arrival that we had to share bathroom with everyone on the floor, not only there was no hot or even warm water for the whole stay, the bathroom was dirty, rubish left in there for days, sink was leaking on the floor so it was always wet. On top of that , the light kept swiching off in the middle of having a shower and toilet paper was not always available. The room was smelly,no towels, no tv, but the receptionist was watching his loudly evenings and mornings, housekeeper completely ingnoring there is guests sleeping at 7am shouting at receptionist through corridor. Local families with no accomodation stay here monday till friday so kids in nappies are running up and down the corridor late at night and early mornings. There is no hair dryer or iron available so take your own if you can brave staying here in the first place! The location is great considering it is next to main train station but it smells of urine, people sleep on the door step and lots of questionable characters lurking. If you want to enjoy Rome stay anywhere but here!

Reviews.Title: “nightmare in rome”
Reviews.Author: tan c Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: what the terrible hotel ... i was stayed 3 night in urbis hotel ..no air condition no water heaters...very slow wifi like a turtle ..very disappointed! if u like have a nice trip in rome i dont recommended this hotel !is totally spoil ur mood

Reviews.Title: “Nice spacious rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Amy B
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of its cheapness and managed to get the room even cheaper by having a shared bathroom which suited me fine as our room was a lot bigger! The hotel was very basic which was just what we wanted because there is soo much to do in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, friendly, helpful”
Reviews.Author: RW1951
Reviews.Content: If you're on a budget, this is the perfect place. Just next to the central station (Roma Termini), you can easily get to everything in Rome. We had a great experience at the Urbis!

Reviews.Title: “It wasnt so bad”
Reviews.Author: Gina S
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my 2 nights in rome through a travel agent. I was really scared once I read the reviews on trip advisor. I was prepared for the worst of the worst. It really wasnt bad. Its obviously one of the cheapest places in rome but it reallt wasnt bad. The pm front desk was so nice and assisted me with everything I needed. I had a huge problem and he assured me that everything would be fine and offered to help me. The graveyard guy was an old bitter man. He was getting irriatated with me hanging out late in the lobby to use the free wifi. Anyways for the low price you pay this is an acceptable place to lay your head down at night. It makes me think twice about places that are cheap and have awful reviews and I wont be so scared next time. Its a great location by the way next to Terminal 1 where you can catch all the trains. I work for hotels in San Francisco so im extra picky but like I said it wasnt that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Really not bad at all!”
Reviews.Author: Amy R
Reviews.Content: This place was pretty decent all this considered. Super convenient location next to the Termini and metro stop. The room was clean with a huge window that opened up on the street. Traffic noise was a bit loud but other than that no complaints at all. Rome is an expensive city so this place was a good, cheap find. Will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “I'll go back!”
Reviews.Author: Tess_R01
Reviews.Content: I dont know what the bad reviews where all about!!!....This was my 4th time staying in Hotel Urbis and as always I found it to be absolutely lovely. The staff are ALL very helpful, friendly and obliging....The rooms are roomey, clean and the linen spotless.....Cheers! Tess :-)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Urbis is a dump”
Reviews.Author: bassman46
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Hotel Urbis 3 times over the years and while it was acceptable the first time in 1998 it has deteriorated substantially since then. There seems to have been little or no maintenance over the years and the last visit was really horrifying. At one point we came back to a group of junkies from the nearby Termini Station shooting up in the stairway. While the area around the station is pretty rough it is also centrally located and the nearby metro station makes it a cheap alternative in an increasingly expensive Rome. Hotel Urbis doesn't control the ground floor door like most of the other hotels in the area and this leads to all kinds of rifraf having access to the building. The conditions of the rooms is well documented in the other reviews. You have to be totally desperate to stay in this place.

Reviews.Title: “Reception looks better than room”
Reviews.Author: PCMAGICMAN
Reviews.Content: Small compact room, about 18 inches to 2ft around bed and very small shower / toilet room. Shower rail was broken so nowhere for shower head to be placed. Extractor fan and not been cleaned in years. Behind the bathroom door was an array of body hair and a few bugs. Bedding was clean. Windows opened but the shutter on the outside was shut closed and covered in bird poop. Very little natural light. TV a small poratable CRT was 8ft off the ground and the wires dangled, buttons on the front were broken. No english speaking channels. Asked for 2 extra pillows and they could only supply one. Could be noisy at times at night mainly comming from inside the hotel. Staff helpful and friendly. Terminal for Train and Bus only 2 mins walk. Nearer the bottom end of hotels I have stayed but for a few nights it was ok

Reviews.Title: “Disgraceful hotel”
Reviews.Author: jph0
Reviews.Content: i stayed in the hotel urbis for 4 nights at the start of May and i would plead with travelers thinking of spending their hard earned money, Dont do it. My first impressions were good, it was close to the main train station, Termini, easy enough to find, then the problems started. We were in the room closest to reception, we went out on our first full day there, seen the sights, came back to find that our room had been cleaned and anything of value had been stolen. We had an iphone which was well hidden at the bottom of a full suitcase inside a handbag, inside a zipped pocket stolen, but strangely the charger which was also in the same place was not. You will not believe what they said when we complained.. " its not our fault WE employ romanian cleaners" we argued for the rest of the trip with them but they then claimed not be able to understand english even though they had been speaking it the last 2 days. Bottom line for this hotel... way too expensive for what you pay for customer service non existant rude and abusive staff thieving cleaners ONLY STAY IN THIS HOTEL IF YOU HAVE TOO MUCH MONEY AND LIKE TO LOSE YOUR POSSESIONS

Reviews.Title: “Never again!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PolishTuristPoland
Reviews.Content: It was a very cheap hotel. We paid about 300 euro for the room for 7 nights. Located in the center of the city. The Papal Basilica of Saint Peter, Coloseum and other interesting ancient ruins and monuments are max 5 km from the hotel. The Marghera street is very noisy even after midnight. Our room was quite clean. The litter in our room was cleaned everyday. There was only one bathroom with toilet and shower on the floor, often busy. The towels we got were grey. TV and fan didn't work. Receptionist came to fix them. We got another fan but we could watch only one channel in TV. While watching TV screen turned black and white. Wi-Fi didn't work. On one day I founded two dead cockroaches in the bathroom. The shower's doors were broken. The worst - we left some money in our travel bag (about 50 euro). They simply dissapeard after the cleanig bedroom... Shame! I don't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CynthiaHM
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through a website that included air fare and hotel. The slogan of the hotel is: "Hotel Urbis... your friendly hotel in Rome". Honestly, that´s a lie!. The recepcionists are always grumpy and they were actualy never attentive with us. The room was okay. The sheets were clean, but we did not have a bathroom inside our room, so... we had to walk a long hallway to shower (horrible). The internet connection does not work at all and they do not offer Wi- Fi. The location is actually the only good thing. Besides of what everyone said, the zone is really safe and nice. Termini Station is great!. Do not go to this hotel. It is not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T TRY THIS ONE AT ROME!!!”
Reviews.Author: burnetk
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel Urbis, to find that our room had been given to someone else, eventhough we saw our name on the book. So we were told we had to upgrade to another room and pay €20 extra per night. I questioned this with the receptionist as it wasn't my fault. His reply was ''What choice do you have?'', knowing fine well we had already paid in full via the website. We had to stump up. The reception to the hotel was up some really decrepit stairs, or a really old narrow lift, which looked more like a chicken coup. The room its self had a really cheap naff bed, the walls were filthy, unsure if they had seen a lick of paint for years. The walls were paper thin so you could constantly hear your neighbour and their kids, dusty floors. We were also made to change rooms, to a smaller one, with no TV on the last night. The communal bathrooms was dirty, and on one occasion there were bird droppings all over. I would strongly recommend you avoid this hotel.... Good location- rubbish hotel

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience with Hotel Urbis”
Reviews.Author: yasimi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is terrible with everything especially their poor services and attitude! I’ve reserved this hotel because they can provide 3 beds in one room for my family. But the old man there can’t provide any good services and cannot speak good English when we were trying to ask for hot water! My parent can’t speak English and one day, I’m going to buy something and therefore ask my parent to go back to the hotel first. However, the old men were not allowed my dad to get the key. It is impossible that he can’t recognize my parent because we have already stayed there for 2 nights! He just tried to find some problem and made difficulty to my parent. I’m totally DISSATISFIED with their services and I’m strongly NOT recommended this hotel to everybody! No breakfast, no air-conditioning, plus, bad first impression for my parent who comes from far away to traveling here!

Reviews.Title: “Beware there are RODENTS at Hotel Urbis”
Reviews.Author: kiwipharmacist
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel previously on a trip to Rome- My first experiences of this hotel were very good. Unfortunately on my return this year in January for three nights- we booked a double with shared bathroom for 45 euros per night- things took a turn for the worse on our stay I was part of a six week tour around europe- we stay in a mixture of hotels from one to five stars but do not stay at back-packers. This was the worst hotel i have stayed in during the entire trip. The Good points. 1. The hotel has an excellent location- it is 2 minutes walk from the rome train station- you cannot hear trains so noise is not a problem. 2. There is free internet to use. 3. Its Ok for the price. My Rough Guide book recommends a hotel down the road from this one called Faulty Towers- I think next time I will try that hotel 4. There is a man on reception called Mr Giovanni, he is super-friendly- probably the only thing the hotel has going for it The things the hotel needs to improve on. 1. During the night I heard mice running around the room! 2. The rooms were not cleaned properly- there was still loads of dust on floor. 3 The shared bathroom was DISCUSTING!!! Pooh stains smeared on the side of the bowl- reminded me of an ex-flattie i had to kick out of my flat. Sewage smells etc . the shared bathroom always ran out of loo paper 4. Shower leaked and there was a timer on the shared bathroom which meant lights went out after 10minutes. 5. The hotel must have over-booked in one of the rooms because we were sharing the bathroom with six other German males- early in the morning my sister needed to use the toilet in the other corridor( Our shared toilet was in use ) but was rudely told she could not by a man at reception. I was very disappointed in my stay at this hotel- its sign boasts to be the Romes friendly hotel- When I return to Rome I would not stay here again- I think there is better service at other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad, but expensive”
Reviews.Author: lkpg
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel easy close to Termini. The house looked old and not in so good conditions. Our room was clean but small, no shower and toilet (but in the corridor!). No breakfast but free internet. The staff was friendly and serviceminded. The price for this doubleroom was EUR 95 in the end of october. That I think is much too high

Reviews.Title: “Traveler Beware”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel back in May while I was on a "study abroad" trip through my University with a class of 25 other students. We all had apartments in Firenze, but were taking a weekend trip to Rome. All of us decided we wanted to spend some extra time there, so we were asked to book our own hotel for one night (as it was not included in our program fee.) I booked this hotel ahead of time, being the responsible person that I am, and thought everything was all squared away! WELL, I was wrong! I had read all of these horrible reviews about the hotel before I left, but figured these people just had a bad experience and that "it was only for one night" so it would be fine, but no, Hotel Urbis HAD to find a way to make my trip horrible, as well. I arrived with the 3 other occupants by train to the busy streets of Rome- totally lost in my surroundings...the hotel was easy to find- you could see it from the train station. When I arrived Fabio said they had "no room for me", and proceeded to be completely unhelpful while he leasurely continued to read his newspaper. He handed me a map and said that he had booked a room for me in another hotel- CIAO! They never e-mailed or attempted to contact me in any way before this episode, and I was completely enraged. After an endless search for Hotel Stella (I think it was called), we finally found our NEW place for the night- even though it was dirty and smelly- it was cheap, people were friendly, and they had a great breakfast. Shame on Hotel Urbis :(

Reviews.Title: “No problems here....”
Reviews.Author: thedustgambler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Urbis in May 2006, we stayed for 2 nights, and could not find fault at all with the hotel. It is a budget property, and that is exactly what you are paying for. Very close to Termini, you can see the main entrance as soon as you walk out the front door. The bus service and metro to anywhere in the city all depart from Termini, so very convienent. Tons of cheap shopping and excellent restaurants in the area as well. We were a family of 3 sisters. We each had our own single beds, and yes, there were not heavenly beds, but it was a clean place to rest your head after seeing and walking all over the city. The shower was clean, and we didnt experience anything falling apart or breaking. The staff was friendly, and helped book a tour for us. If you are looking for a luxury hotel, I would suggest paying a small fortune for another hotel. I would rather enjoy my money on food, wine, and fun, than to pay for a hotel room I am only in for a few hours a night. Stay at the Urbis if you dont mind a hotel like a Knights Inn, or a Super 8.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel not for young children- rude staff (the Old Man at the reception)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I think the hotel is not recommended for family with children. I stayed in the hotel and my child bedwets as she has a health problem and due to the cold room. The remark given by the old man was very nasty. Had I not paid in full for the stay I would have looked for another hotel. This is a genuine experience. I have stayed in many hotels in my travels with my family and by far this is the worst hotel.I stayed during my holiday in Rome in May 2005.
